message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has signs of premature puberty and hyperpigmented macules, which suggest McCune-Albright syndrome. Osteogenesis imperfecta typically presents with multiple fractures, while neurofibromatosis type I usually has café-au-lait spots and neurofibromas. Congenital adrenal hyperplasia can also present with premature puberty, but the absence of other symptoms such as salt-wasting or virilization makes it less likely.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of pubic hair, breast development, and hyperpigmented macules with rough, serpiginous borders are all characteristic findings of McCune-Albright syndrome. Osteogenesis imperfecta is characterized by frequent bone fractures, Neurofibromatosis type I has cafe-au-lait spots and neurofibromas, and Congenital adrenal hyperplasia may also present with pubic hair development but not with the other typical findings of this case.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s history of fractures and hyperpigmented macules with serpiginous borders, along with the early onset of pubic hair development and breast bud enlargement, are all signs of McCune-Albright syndrome, a rare genetic disorder. Osteogenesis imperfecta would present with multiple fractures but not early onset puberty or hyperpigmented macules, while neurofibromatosis type I would have café-au-lait spots instead of hyperpigmented macules. Congenital adrenal hyperplasia would present with ambiguous genitalia instead of early onset puberty in females.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has precocious puberty indicated by pubic hair development and breast gland enlargement before the age of 8. The hyperpigmented macules and fractures suggest McCune-Albright syndrome, which is characterized by mutations in the GNAS gene that cause early activation of hormones such as luteinizing hormone and follicle-stimulating hormone, leading to precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of pubic hair and breast development at such a young age, along with multiple fractures and hyperpigmented macules with rough, serpiginous borders, suggest the most likely diagnosis is McCune-Albright syndrome. The other options have different symptoms and signs.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of pubic hair, breast bud extension, and hyperpigmented macules suggest precocious puberty. Among the options, only McCune-Albright syndrome is associated with precocious puberty as well as bone fractures and hyperpigmented macules with rough borders. Osteogenesis imperfecta is associated with bone fractures, but not precocious puberty or hyperpigmented macules. Neurofibromatosis type I can cause hyperpigmented macules but not precocious puberty. Congenital adrenal hyperplasia can also cause precocious puberty but is not associated with hyperpigmented macules or bone fractures.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of pubic hair development and breast gland enlargement at a young age suggests precocious puberty. The hyperpigmented macules with rough, serpiginous borders are also characteristic of McCune-Albright syndrome. None of the other options match the symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of pubic hair and breast development in a 7-year-old girl is suggestive of precocious puberty, and among the options, the most likely cause is McCune-Albright syndrome. The hyperpigmented macules with rough, serpiginous borders, known as cafè-au-lait spots, are a characteristic feature of the syndrome. Osteogenesis imperfecta presents with frequent fractures, but the other symptoms are not consistent with this diagnosis, and congenital adrenal hyperplasia typically presents with ambiguous genitalia. Neurofibromatosis type I can also cause cafè-au-lait spots, but it is not usually associated with precocious puberty.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of pubic hair and breast development in such a young age indicates precocious puberty. The hyperpigmented macules suggest the diagnosis of McCune-Albright syndrome, a disorder characterized by polyostotic fibrous dysplasia, endocrine dysfunction (including precocious puberty), and café-au-lait spots. The history of multiple fractures is not specific to any of the options.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only McCune-Albright syndrome involves precocious puberty and skin abnormalities such as the described hyperpigmented macules. Osteogenesis imperfecta is a genetic disorder of bones, while neurofibromatosis type I involves multiple cafe-au-lait spots and benign tumors. Congenital adrenal hyperplasia involves ambiguous genitalia and high levels of androgens, but not necessarily precocious puberty.
